"Breaking barriers: empowering African youth through implementation of a therapeutic patient education program for juvenile idiopathic arthritis"

Author: Hamdi, Wafa1; Migowa, Angela2; Lassoued Ferjani, Hanene1; Fazaa, Alia3; Faleye, Ayodele4; Miladi, Saoussen3; Maatallah, Kaouther1; Ben Abdelghani, Kawther31 Department of Rheumatology, Kassab Institute, Faculty of Medicine of Tunis, Tunis El Manar University, Tunis, Tunisia2 Department of Paediatrics and Child Health, Aga Khan University Medical College East Africa, Nairobi, Kenya3 Department of Rheumatology, Mongi Slim Hospital, Faculty of Medicine of Tunis, Tunis El Manar University, Tunis, Tunisia4 Paediatric Rheumatology Unit, Department of Paediatrics, Lagos State University Teaching Hospital, Ikeja, Lagos, Nigeria

Publication info: Hamdi, Wafa; Migowa, Angela; Lassoued Ferjani, Hanene; Fazaa, Alia; Faleye, Ayodele; et al. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/breaking-barriers-empowering-african-youth/docview/3147134982/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Patient education is crucial in managing chronic diseases like Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA). Traditional methods such as videos and brochures often fail to maintain long-term knowledge retention. Therapeutic Patient Education (TPE) offers a more effective, patient-centered approach. Introduction Patient education is crucial in managing chronic diseases like Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis (JIA). Traditional methods such as videos and brochures often fail to maintain long-term knowledge retention. Therapeutic Patient Education (TPE) offers a more effective, patient-centered approach.PAFLAR aimed to implement a TPE program with a "train the trainers" masterclass to ensure effective delivery and improve outcomes for children with JIA. Objective PAFLAR aimed to implement a TPE program with a "train the trainers" masterclass to ensure effective delivery and improve outcomes for children with JIA.PAFLAR's TPE program was designed through a focus group, involving a literature review and strategic planning for the implementation step. The program includes specialized training for healthcare professionals enhancing their abilities to deliver TPE workshops. Participants were selected based on volunteerism and commitment to the project. Evaluations were conducted through feedback assessment of both patients and participants. Methods PAFLAR's TPE program was designed through a focus group, involving a literature review and strategic planning for the implementation step. The program includes specialized training for healthcare professionals enhancing their abilities to deliver TPE workshops. Participants were selected based on volunteerism and commitment to the project. Evaluations were conducted through feedback assessment of both patients and participants.PAFLAR launched a TPE program in 2023, aimed at training healthcare providers to implement TPE effectively. This initiative included both in-person and virtual masterclasses, resulting in five workshops conducted in Kenya, Tunisia, and Nigeria. These workshops covered various aspects of JIA management, such as patient and family education, self-esteem, physical activity, treatment adherence, and pain management. Early results showed significant improvements in patients' and parents' understanding and management of JIA, with positive feedback indicating a need for further sessions. Results PAFLAR launched a TPE program in 2023, aimed at training healthcare providers to implement TPE effectively. This initiative included both in-person and virtual masterclasses, resulting in five workshops conducted in Kenya, Tunisia, and Nigeria. These workshops covered various aspects of JIA management, such as patient and family education, self-esteem, physical activity, treatment adherence, and pain management. Early results showed significant improvements in patients' and parents' understanding and management of JIA, with positive feedback indicating a need for further sessions.PAFLAR has taken the initial step in implementing a TPE program for JIA across three countries, representing different regions of Africa. The TPE program offers a promising alternative to traditional patient education methods, significantly improving patient care, empowering healthcare providers, and advancing healthcare systems. Conclusion PAFLAR has taken the initial step in implementing a TPE program for JIA across three countries, representing different regions of Africa. The TPE program offers a promising alternative to traditional patient education methods, significantly improving patient care, empowering healthcare providers, and advancing healthcare systems.

Sleep medicine and chronobiology education among Brazilian medical students

Author: Novais, Y C1    ; Borges, J1    ; Ferreira-Moraes, F A1    ; Tamura, E K1    1 Grupo de Pesquisa em Cronobiologia, Departamento de Ciências da Saúde, Universidade Estadual de Santa Cruz, Ilhéus, BA, Brasil

Publication info: Novais, Y C; Borges, J; Ferreira-Moraes, F A; Tamura, E K. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/sleep-medicine-chronobiology-education-among/docview/3147134609/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Chronobiology and sleep medicine are pivotal disciplines for understanding human health. Additionally, the lack of training in medical schools exacerbates the underdiagnosis and undertreatment of sleep disorders. This study investigated the exposure of Brazilian medical students to chronobiology and sleep medicine during their undergraduate education and assessed their knowledge in these areas. The study was conducted between December 2021 and June 2022 through the administration of an online questionnaire (Google Forms) to medical students in the final two years of undergraduate studies. The questionnaire gathered student data (i.e., sex, age, and educational institution), research data (stage in the medical program with exposure to chronobiology or sleep medicine), and responses to a questionnaire on basic knowledge of sleep medicine and chronobiology (adapted from Assessing Sleep Knowledge in Medical Education - ASKME). A total of 240 students from medical schools in Brazil participated, 4.6% of whom reported no exposure to either subject, with exposure declining as students progressed through the curriculum. Only 3.7% reported specific disciplines covering these topics. Over half of the students encountered learning barriers, such as limited curriculum time. Despite these challenges, the accuracy rate in responses regarding chronobiology and sleep medicine was 79.75%, positively correlating with exposure level and knowledge retention. This study underscores the urgent need for enhanced education in sleep medicine and chronobiology within Brazilian medical schools. It offers insights into the current landscape of sleep medicine education in Brazil and lays groundwork for future efforts to integrate these essential subjects into medical school curricula.Chronobiology and sleep medicine are pivotal disciplines for understanding human health. Additionally, the lack of training in medical schools exacerbates the underdiagnosis and undertreatment of sleep disorders. This study investigated the exposure of Brazilian medical students to chronobiology and sleep medicine during their undergraduate education and assessed their knowledge in these areas. The study was conducted between December 2021 and June 2022 through the administration of an online questionnaire (Google Forms) to medical students in the final two years of undergraduate studies. The questionnaire gathered student data (i.e., sex, age, and educational institution), research data (stage in the medical program with exposure to chronobiology or sleep medicine), and responses to a questionnaire on basic knowledge of sleep medicine and chronobiology (adapted from Assessing Sleep Knowledge in Medical Education - ASKME). A total of 240 students from medical schools in Brazil participated, 4.6% of whom reported no exposure to either subject, with exposure declining as students progressed through the curriculum. Only 3.7% reported specific disciplines covering these topics. Over half of the students encountered learning barriers, such as limited curriculum time. Despite these challenges, the accuracy rate in responses regarding chronobiology and sleep medicine was 79.75%, positively correlating with exposure level and knowledge retention. This study underscores the urgent need for enhanced education in sleep medicine and chronobiology within Brazilian medical schools. It offers insights into the current landscape of sleep medicine education in Brazil and lays groundwork for future efforts to integrate these essential subjects into medical school curricula.

Improving Web Readability Using Video Content: A Relevance-Based Approach

Author: Elahi, Ehsan1    ; Morato, Jorge2    ; Iglesias, Ana2    1 Departamento de Informatica, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, 28911 Leganés, Spain; jmorato@inf.uc3m.es (J.M.); aiglesia@inf.uc3m.es (A.I.); Department of Computer Science and Information Technology, The University of Lahore, Lahore 54590, Pakistan2 Departamento de Informatica, Universidad Carlos III de Madrid, 28911 Leganés, Spain; jmorato@inf.uc3m.es (J.M.); aiglesia@inf.uc3m.es (A.I.)

Publication info: Elahi, Ehsan; Morato, Jorge; Iglesias, Ana. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/improving-web-readability-using-video-content/docview/3143961302/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: With the increasing integration of multimedia elements into webpages, videos have emerged as a popular medium for enhancing user engagement and knowledge retention. However, irrelevant or poorly placed videos can hinder readability and distract users from the core content of a webpage. This paper proposes a novel approach leveraging natural language processing (NLP) techniques to assess the relevance of video content on educational websites, thereby enhancing readability and user engagement. By using a cosine similarity-based relevance scoring method, we measured the alignment between video transcripts and webpage text, aiming to improve the user’s comprehension of complex topics presented on educational platforms. Our results demonstrated a strong correlation between automated relevance scores and user ratings, with an improvement of over 35% in relevance alignment. The methodology was evaluated across 50 educational websites representing diverse subjects, including science, mathematics, and language learning. We conducted a two-phase evaluation process: an automated scoring phase using cosine similarity, followed by a user study with 100 participants who rated the relevance of videos to webpage content. The findings support the significance of integrating NLP-driven video relevance assessments for enhanced readability on educational websites, highlighting the potential for broader applications in e-learning.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Ehsan&amp;aulast=Elahi&amp;atitle=Improving+Web+Readability+Using+Video+Content%3A+A+Relevance-Based+Approach&amp;stitle=Applied+Sciences&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.3390%2Fapp142311055&amp;title=Improving+Web+Readability+Using+Video+Content%3A+A+Relevance-Based+Approach&amp;volume=14&amp;issue=23&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=11055&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Ehsan&amp;aulast=Elahi&amp;atitle=Improving+Web+Readability+Using+Video+Content%3A+A+Relevance-Based+Approach&amp;stitle=Applied+Sciences&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.3390%2Fapp142311055&amp;title=Improving+Web+Readability+Using+Video+Content%3A+A+Relevance-Based+Approach&amp;volume=14&amp;issue=23&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=11055&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Subject: Readability; Machine learning; Educational technology; Web site design; Usability; Designers; Video recordings; Multimedia; Teachers

Business indexing term: Subject: Machine learning Designers

Identifier / keyword: webpage; readability; video; usability; evaluation

Title: Improving Web Readability Using Video Content: A Relevance-Based Approach

Publication title: Applied Sciences; Basel

Volume: 14

Issue: 23

First page: 11055

Publication year: 2024

Publication date: 2024

Publisher: MDPI AG

Place of publication: Basel

Country of publication: Switzerland

Publication subject: Sciences: Comprehensive Works

e-ISSN: 20763417

Source type: Scholarly Journal

Mentorship as a tool for improving construction artisan's skills to achieve sustainable development Goal 8 via qualitative approach

Author: Ebekozien, Andrew1    ; Aigbavboa, Clinton Ohis2; Mohamad Shaharudin Samsurijan3; Aliu, John4    ; Angeline Ngozika Chibuike Nwaole51 Department of Construction Management and Quantity Surveying, University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa; Department of Quantity Surveying, Auchi Polytechnic, Auchi, Nigeria; School of Social Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Minden, Malaysia2 Department of Construction Management and Quantity Surveying, University of Johannesburg – Doornfontein Campus, Doornfontein, South Africa3 School of Social Sciences, Universiti Sains Malaysia, Minden, Malaysia4 Department of Construction Management and Quantity Surveying, University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa; Department of Civil Engineering, Institute for Resilient Infrastructure Systems, Athens, Georgia, USA; University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa5 Department of Quantity Surveying, Federal Polytechnic Nekede, Owerri, Nigeria

Publication info: Ebekozien, Andrew; Aigbavboa, Clinton Ohis; Mohamad Shaharudin Samsurijan; Aliu, John; Angeline Ngozika Chibuike Nwaole. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/mentorship-as-tool-improving-construction/docview/3142715992/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Purpose The paucity of artisans in some construction trades and the transitioning of the experience of the few for sustainability calls for concern. Mentorship programmes offer a promising mechanism to support construction artisans through those transitions. Mentorship may enhance artisan decent work and economic growth, like increased income for artisans. This is part of Sustainable Development Goal 8 (Goal 8). Hence, this study aims to investigate issues hindering construction artisan skills growth and suggest measures to improve construction artisan skills through mentorship mechanisms to achieve Goal 8. Design/methodology/approach The study adopted a qualitative approach and collected data via oral interviews with knowledgeable participants. The participants were consultant experts in mentorship and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) matters, construction organisation management staffers and construction artisans in the Nigerian construction industry. The study covered Lagos and Abuja and achieved saturation at the 30th interviewee. Also, the research utilised a thematic method to analyse the collated data. Findings Enhanced knowledge sharing accelerates junior artisans’ learning skills quickly, improving artisans’ performance, ensuring sustainability of the skills learned (knowledge retention), encouraging collaboration, building the next generation of leaders and transitioning of experience to mentees emerged as mentorship’s role in developing construction artisans’ skills. Findings show that mentorship mechanisms to develop construction artisan skills face encumbrances. The perceived 32 encumbrances were re-clustered into mentee, mentor and government-related encumbrances. Also, achieving Goal 8 regarding construction artisans may be threatened if these issues are not checked. Thus, the study recommended measures improving construction artisan skills through mentorship mechanisms to achieve Goal 8. Originality/value Identifying the major encumbrances facing construction artisan skills improvement through mentorship would be useful to advocate measures to improve construction artisan’s skills to achieve Goal 8.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Andrew&amp;aulast=Ebekozien&amp;atitle=Mentorship+as+a+tool+for+improving+construction+artisan%27s+skills+to+achieve+sustainable+development+Goal+8+via+qualitative+approach&amp;stitle=Engineering%2C+Construction+and+Architectural+Management&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1108%2FECAM-07-2023-0655&amp;title=Mentorship+as+a+tool+for+improving+construction+artisan%27s+skills+to+achieve+sustainable+development+Goal+8+via+qualitative+approach&amp;volume=31&amp;issue=13&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=303&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Andrew&amp;aulast=Ebekozien&amp;atitle=Mentorship+as+a+tool+for+improving+construction+artisan%27s+skills+to+achieve+sustainable+development+Goal+8+via+qualitative+approach&amp;stitle=Engineering%2C+Construction+and+Architectural+Management&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1108%2FECAM-07-2023-0655&amp;title=Mentorship+as+a+tool+for+improving+construction+artisan%27s+skills+to+achieve+sustainable+development+Goal+8+via+qualitative+approach&amp;volume=31&amp;issue=13&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=303&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Subject: Qualitative analysis; Young adults; Mentors; Sustainable development; Knowledge; Adult learning; Employment; Skills; Knowledge management; Skill development; Artisans; Developing countries--LDCs; Industrial development; Construction industry; Apprenticeship; Economic growth; Economic development; Data collection

Is virtual reality enhancing dental anatomy education? A systematic review and meta-analysis

Author: Bevizova, Katarina; Hisham El Falougy; Thurzo, Andrej; Harsanyi, Stefan

Publication info: Bevizova, Katarina; Hisham El Falougy; Thurzo, Andrej; Harsanyi, Stefan. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/is-virtual-reality-enhancing-dental-anatomy/docview/3142294219/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Background Traditional dental anatomy education, reliant on cadaver dissections and lectures, faces challenges such as high costs, ethical concerns, and difficulty conveying complex 3D dental structures. Virtual reality (VR) offers a solution by providing immersive, interactive learning environments that can enhance students’ understanding. This study systematically reviews the effectiveness of VR in dental anatomy education compared to traditional methods, focusing on its potential to improve learning outcomes. Methods A comprehensive search was conducted across Web of Science (WoS), PubMed, and Scopus databases until May 2024. Data were extracted, summarized, and analyzed for qualitative synthesis. The following keywords and their combinations were used: " dental OR dentistry”, “education OR teaching”, “virtual AND reality OR VR”, and “anatomy OR dental AND anatomy”. Studies were included if they met the following criteria: Investigated the use of VR in anatomy education. Compared VR-based learning to other methods such as lecture-based teaching, 3D printed or natural models, or non-interactive 3D models. Quantitative synthesis was performed using standardized mean differences (SMD) with Hedges’d and 95% confidence intervals (CI). Results Out of 178 records screened, seven studies were included in the meta-analysis and eight in the personal evaluation analysis. The analysis indicates a moderately positive effect of VR on dental anatomy education (SMD = 0.74, p  = 0.05) compared to lecture-based education using X-ray, CBCT, or 3D models. However, at the same time, VR falls short compared to clinical experience, training with physical teeth, or quality printed models. Studies reported rare cases of discomfort, disorientation, diplopic image, and VR sickness. Conclusions The use of VR-based learning moderately positively affects educational outcomes, and enhances knowledge retention, especially before clinical experience. The personal evaluation of students showed a strong interest in VR, with positive feedback on its ease of use, accuracy, and educational value.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Katarina&amp;aulast=Bevizova&amp;atitle=Is+virtual+reality+enhancing+dental+anatomy+education%3F+A+systematic+review+and+meta-analysis&amp;stitle=BMC+Medical+Education&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1186%2Fs12909-024-06233-0&amp;title=Is+virtual+reality+enhancing+dental+anatomy+education%3F+A+systematic+review+and+meta-analysis&amp;volume=24&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=1&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Katarina&amp;aulast=Bevizova&amp;atitle=Is+virtual+reality+enhancing+dental+anatomy+education%3F+A+systematic+review+and+meta-analysis&amp;stitle=BMC+Medical+Education&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1186%2Fs12909-024-06233-0&amp;title=Is+virtual+reality+enhancing+dental+anatomy+education%3F+A+systematic+review+and+meta-analysis&amp;volume=24&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=1&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Immersive technology and hand hygiene: scoping review

Author: Muršec, Dominika; Turk, Sonja Šostar; Rozman, Urš ka; Lorber, Mateja; Fijačko, Nino; Vrbnjak, Dominika

Publication info: Muršec, Dominika; Turk, Sonja Šostar; Rozman, Urška; Lorber, Mateja; Fijačko, Nino; et al. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/immersive-technology-hand-hygiene-scoping-review/docview/3142293717/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Background The use of immersive technology in healthcare education is on the rise, yet its impact on learner engagement, knowledge retention, and specifically in areas like hand hygiene training, remains underexplored. The aim of this scoping review was to summarize the existing studies of immersive technology in hand hygiene training of healthcare providers and health professions students. Methods A scoping review following the Levac et al. framework was conducted. The literature search was performed in databases PubMed, CINAHL Ultimate, ScienceDirect (Elsevier), Web of Science in addition to Google Scholar and ProQuest Dissertation & Theses. The Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analysis: Extension for Scoping Reviews (PRIMSA-ScR) guideline was used to report the results. We analysed data using tabular and descriptive summary. Results In the final analysis 11 studies from seven countries were included. Most of the studies ( n  = 10, 90,91%) used virtual reality in hand hygiene training of healthcare providers and health professions students. Most studies have found that immersive technology is useful in teaching hand hygiene ( n  = 6, 54,55%). There are some theories and concepts that support the teaching of hand hygiene with immersive technology, but most of the research is not supported by them. Theories or concepts were included in two studies (18,18%). Conclusion Immersive technology, especially virtual reality, enhances hand hygiene learning and engagement compared to traditional methods. However, most studies lack theoretical support. To advance this field, exploring immersive technology for further research and incorporating relevant theories is encouraged. Additionally, conducting a thorough cost-effectiveness analysis and establishing a robust evaluation framework, encompassing both short-term and long-term outcomes, will be beneficial for a comprehensive understanding of the impact of immersive technology in hand hygiene education.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Dominika&amp;aulast=Mur%C5%A1ec&amp;atitle=Immersive+technology+and+hand+hygiene%3A+scoping+review&amp;stitle=BMC+Medical+Education&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1186%2Fs12909-024-06320-2&amp;title=Immersive+technology+and+hand+hygiene%3A+scoping+review&amp;volume=24&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=1&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Dominika&amp;aulast=Mur%C5%A1ec&amp;atitle=Immersive+technology+and+hand+hygiene%3A+scoping+review&amp;stitle=BMC+Medical+Education&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1186%2Fs12909-024-06320-2&amp;title=Immersive+technology+and+hand+hygiene%3A+scoping+review&amp;volume=24&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=1&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Next-Gen Safety Training: ICT Solutions for Informal Workers in Colombia

Author: Puello-Socarras, Gregorio E1    1 Safety and health at work management programme, Corporació n Universitaria Minuto de Dios - UNIMINUTO,Bogotá,Colombia

Publication info: Puello-Socarras, Gregorio E. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/next-gen-safety-training-ict-solutions-informal/docview/3140640761/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 IEEE Global Humanitarian Technology Conference (GHTC) Conference Start Date: 2024, Oct. 23 Conference End Date: 2024, Oct. 26 Conference Location: Radnor, PA, USA This paper explores the utilization of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) solutions to address safety training concerns among informal workers in Colombia. The informal sector, particularly prevalent in industries like mining, presents unique challenges regarding occupational health and safety. By leveraging next-generation ICT tools, such as virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and mobile applications, this study aims to enhance safety training effectiveness and accessibility for informal workers in Colombia. Drawing upon existing literature and case studies, the paper evaluates the potential of ICT solutions to bridge gaps in traditional safety training methods, offering tailored, interactive, and immersive experiences. Additionally, it discusses the integration of culturally sensitive content and user-friendly interfaces to ensure maximum engagement and knowledge retention. Through a comprehensive analysis of current practices and emerging technologies, this paper underscores the transformative impact of ICT solutions in fostering a safer work environment for informal workers in Colombia.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Gregorio&amp;aulast=Puello-Socarras&amp;atitle=Next-Gen+Safety+Training%3A+ICT+Solutions+for+Informal+Workers+in+Colombia&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FGHTC62424.2024.10771514&amp;title=Next-Gen+Safety+Training%3A+ICT+Solutions+for+Informal+Workers+in+Colombia&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

Design Mechanics and Gameplay using LM-GM of a Serious Game for Preventing Smoking in Teenagers

Author: Fahmi, Azhar Iskandar1; Hidayah, Indriana1; Ferdiana, Ridi1; Moch Nurul Indra Al Fauzan11 Universitas Gadjah Mada,Department of Electrical and Information Engginering,Yogyakarta,Indonesia

Publication info: Fahmi, Azhar Iskandar; Hidayah, Indriana; Ferdiana, Ridi; Moch Nurul Indra Al Fauzan. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/design-mechanics-gameplay-using-lm-gm-serious/docview/3140636185/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 International Conference on Information Technology and Computing (ICITCOM) Conference Start Date: 2024, Aug. 7 Conference End Date: 2024, Aug. 8 Conference Location: Yogyakarta, Indonesia Serious games are a potential medium for health promotion, especially for preventing smoking in adolescents. One aspect that is important to design is game mechanics and game play that are effective for the target user. This study evaluates the design mechanics and gameplay effectiveness of a serious game, “Smoverse 2,” developed to enhance preventive education on the dangers of smoking among adolescents aged 13–15 years. Utilizing the Learning Mechanics-Game Mechanics (LM-GM) model, the game was designed to balance educational content with engaging gameplay to improve learning outcomes. “Smoverse 2,” a role-playing game, was compared to “Smoverse 1,” an action-adventure game, to assess their impacts on player engagement and knowledge retention. The study involved 90 middle school students, divided into control and experimental groups, using A/B testing methodology. The Game Experience Questionnaire (GEQ) was employed to measure various dimensions of the player experience, including immersion, flow, competence, positive and negative affect, tension, and challenge. Results indicate that “Smoverse 2” significantly improves player engagement and educational effectiveness by effectively integrating entertainment aspects, thereby demonstrating the value of balancing educational content with engaging game mechanics in serious games.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Azhar&amp;aulast=Fahmi&amp;atitle=Design+Mechanics+and+Gameplay+using+LM-GM+of+a+Serious+Game+for+Preventing+Smoking+in+Teenagers&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICITCOM62788.2024.10762370&amp;title=Design+Mechanics+and+Gameplay+using+LM-GM+of+a+Serious+Game+for+Preventing+Smoking+in+Teenagers&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Azhar&amp;aulast=Fahmi&amp;atitle=Design+Mechanics+and+Gameplay+using+LM-GM+of+a+Serious+Game+for+Preventing+Smoking+in+Teenagers&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICITCOM62788.2024.10762370&amp;title=Design+Mechanics+and+Gameplay+using+LM-GM+of+a+Serious+Game+for+Preventing+Smoking+in+Teenagers&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

DFedMD: Decentralized Federated Learning using Model Distillation

Author: Abiru, Shouta1; Tamura, Keiichi11 Graduated School of Information Sciences, Hiroshima City University,Hiroshima,Japan

Publication info: Abiru, Shouta; Tamura, Keiichi. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/dfedmd-decentralized-federated-learning-using/docview/3140607362/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 Joint 13th International Conference on Soft Computing and Intelligent Systems and 25th International Symposium on Advanced Intelligent Systems (SCIS&ISIS) Conference Start Date: 2024, Nov. 9 Conference End Date: 2024, Nov. 12 Conference Location: Himeji, Japan Conventional machine learning methods require devices to transfer their data to a central server because the server intensively stores all the data and trains the model. However, if the data are sensitive or large in volume, sending them may cause problems in terms of privacy and network bandwidth consumption. To address these problems, federated learning (FL), in which data are distributed across devices without being aggregated into a server, has garnered attention. Moreover, decentralized FL (DFL) is a serverless learning method that improves the accuracy of each client model by exchanging information necessary for model learning with neighboring clients in a distributed network to which the clients are directly connected. In this study, we propose a novel method of DFL that maintains data and model secrecy through knowledge distillation. To use knowledge distillation effectively, we utilize a data-free model distillation using mismatch data. Furthermore, to avoid rapid accuracy degradation during training, the knowledge loss function in the proposed method incorporates the output of its initial model into error calculations. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method improves accuracy compared with the case in which each client learns using only their own data.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Shouta&amp;aulast=Abiru&amp;atitle=DFedMD%3A+Decentralized+Federated+Learning+using+Model+Distillation&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FSCISISIS61014.2024.10759998&amp;title=DFedMD%3A+Decentralized+Federated+Learning+using+Model+Distillation&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Shouta&amp;aulast=Abiru&amp;atitle=DFedMD%3A+Decentralized+Federated+Learning+using+Model+Distillation&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FSCISISIS61014.2024.10759998&amp;title=DFedMD%3A+Decentralized+Federated+Learning+using+Model+Distillation&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

The Effectiveness of the Pitstop Method of Teaching Among Phase II Medical Students

Author: Balasubramanian Subalakshmi; Sreekumar, E J; Balasubramanian Nellaiyappan; Thyagarajan Mohanapriya; Mariappan Shanthi; Sundaram Sandhya; Balaji, Singh K

Publication info: Balasubramanian Subalakshmi; Sreekumar, E J; Balasubramanian Nellaiyappan; Thyagarajan Mohanapriya; Mariappan Shanthi; et al. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/effectiveness-pitstop-method-teaching-among-phase/docview/3134440253/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Background and objectives The pitstop method of teaching involves short educational videos that entail a stepwise approach to augment knowledge retention and understanding. Short videos stimulate both visual and auditory pathways, thereby improving learner’s experiences, knowledge retention, and understanding of the concept, which will help with long-term memory. In this study, we aimed to compare the pitstop method of teaching with the didactic lecture technique based on assessment and feedback. Methodology After obtaining the Institutional Ethics Committee (IEC) approval, a comparative cross-sectional study was conducted among 210 phase II MBBS students who gave consent to participate in the study. Two sessions comprising a total of 10 videos with five videos in each session were planned for a particular system. Two types of teaching methodology were used in the videos. For session 1, a short video using a presentation template was used. For session 2, a short video using hand notes and figures was prepared and incorporated into the video. Each video was two minutes in duration. Students were divided into A and B batches. For session 1, A batch was the control group and B batch was the test group; for session 2, the test and control groups were reversed. Pre-test and post-test exercises were conducted for each session. Results were analyzed and statistical analysis was performed at the end of the project. Results An analysis of both sessions was done for the A and B batches. For session 1, the test group fared well with a mean of 4.50 compared to the control group with a mean of 3.53. For session 2, the test group performed well with a mean of 4.43 compared to the control group with a mean of 3.87. No significant difference was observed when the test groups of the two sessions were compared (p=0.74). Conclusions Short videos delivered by using the pitstop method will help stimulate memory and enhance the attention of students to better process the information. We believe that the implementation of this method will lead to good outcomes among the students.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=&amp;aulast=Balasubramanian+Subalakshmi&amp;atitle=The+Effectiveness+of+the+Pitstop+Method+of+Teaching+Among+Phase+II+Medical+Students&amp;stitle=Cureus&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.7759%2Fcureus.71906&amp;title=The+Effectiveness+of+the+Pitstop+Method+of+Teaching+Among+Phase+II+Medical+Students&amp;volume=16&amp;issue=10&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=&amp;aulast=Balasubramanian+Subalakshmi&amp;atitle=The+Effectiveness+of+the+Pitstop+Method+of+Teaching+Among+Phase+II+Medical+Students&amp;stitle=Cureus&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.7759%2Fcureus.71906&amp;title=The+Effectiveness+of+the+Pitstop+Method+of+Teaching+Among+Phase+II+Medical+Students&amp;volume=16&amp;issue=10&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Global and Local Graph Convolution Network for Multi-Label Class Incremental Learning

Author: Xu, Jianhang1; Tan, Anhui1; Gu, Shenming11 Zhejiang Ocean University,School of Information Engineering,Zhoushan,China,316022

Publication info: Xu, Jianhang; Tan, Anhui; Gu, Shenming. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/global-local-graph-convolution-network-multi/docview/3133495660/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 5th International Conference on Big Data & Artificial Intelligence & Software Engineering (ICBASE) Conference Start Date: 2024, Sept. 20 Conference End Date: 2024, Sept. 22 Conference Location: Wenzhou, China Despite significant progresses in single-label class incremental learning (CIL), its multi-label counterpart remains relatively understudied which is called multi-label class incremental learning (MLCIL). In MLCIL, newly introduced samples are exclusively labeled with new classes, necessitating heavy reliance on pseudo-label generation to compensate for missing annotations. Simply adapting CIL methods to MLCIL is ineffective due to the challenges of catastrophic forgetting and lack of learned labels. To address these issues, we propose Global and Local Graph Convolution Network (GL-GCN), incorporating Global Graph Convolution Network (G-GConv) and Local Graph Convolution Network (L-GConv) modules. GGConv captures inter-session connections, while L-GConv preserves intra-session class relationships for knowledge retention. Additionally, asymmetric loss is introduced to mitigate class imbalance. Experimental results demonstrate our method’s superiority over existing approaches.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Jianhang&amp;aulast=Xu&amp;atitle=Global+and+Local+Graph+Convolution+Network+for+Multi-Label+Class+Incremental+Learning&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICBASE63199.2024.10762125&amp;title=Global+and+Local+Graph+Convolution+Network+for+Multi-Label+Class+Incremental+Learning&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Jianhang&amp;aulast=Xu&amp;atitle=Global+and+Local+Graph+Convolution+Network+for+Multi-Label+Class+Incremental+Learning&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICBASE63199.2024.10762125&amp;title=Global+and+Local+Graph+Convolution+Network+for+Multi-Label+Class+Incremental+Learning&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

The Effectiveness of Applying Artificial Intelligence in Sick Children’s Communication

Author: Hsin-Shu Huang1; Lee, Bih-O2    1 Department of Nursing, Central Taiwan University of Science and Technology, Taichung 40601, Taiwan2 College of Nursing, Kaohsiung Medical University, Kaohsiung 80708, Taiwan; biholee@kmu.edu.tw

Publication info: Hsin-Shu Huang; Lee, Bih-O. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/effectiveness-applying-artificial-intelligence/docview/3133025937/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Pediatric nursing students are required to be taught how to overcome their own psychological stress during their internship in order to understand sick children’s emotional reactions, as well as to be able to interact and communicate with such children. This quasi-experimental study proves that the application of AI image health education e-books by the nursing teacher is more effective than traditional paper handout teaching materials in improving nursing students’ self-efficacy when using therapeutic games to deal with and reduce sick children’s fears of medical examinations and treatments ( p < 0.05). AI-driven tools can enable the development of personalized e-learning materials that target specific areas for cognitive improvement. This targeted approach can enhance knowledge retention and skill development, resulting in better-prepared healthcare professionals.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=&amp;aulast=Hsin-Shu+Huang&amp;atitle=The+Effectiveness+of+Applying+Artificial+Intelligence+in+Sick+Children%26rsquo%3Bs+Communication&amp;stitle=Bioengineering&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.3390%2Fbioengineering11111097&amp;title=The+Effectiveness+of+Applying+Artificial+Intelligence+in+Sick+Children%E2%80%99s+Communication&amp;volume=11&amp;issue=11&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=1097&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=&amp;aulast=Hsin-Shu+Huang&amp;atitle=The+Effectiveness+of+Applying+Artificial+Intelligence+in+Sick+Children%26rsquo%3Bs+Communication&amp;stitle=Bioengineering&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.3390%2Fbioengineering11111097&amp;title=The+Effectiveness+of+Applying+Artificial+Intelligence+in+Sick+Children%E2%80%99s+Communication&amp;volume=11&amp;issue=11&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=1097&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Technological Interface Components That Support Accelerated Learning in the Acquisition of Foreign Language Vocabulary

Author: Passig, David; Ganit Eshel Kedmi; Aharoni, Adi

Publication info: Passig, David; Ganit Eshel Kedmi; Aharoni, Adi. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/technological-interface-components-that-support/docview/3132856246/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: There is a need to find innovative learning methods that enable accelerated learning of a foreign language. This study examined the effect of computer-assisted language learning (CALL) in acquiring a foreign language, which combines cognitive and emotional stimuli in the background. The study explored two factors related to the acquisition of a foreign language: the duration and scope of the learning process and the depth of internalization of the newly acquired language. Another objective was to assess the learning method in two learning environments, 2D and VR, to determine if the learning environment affects the learning results and leads to better vocabulary retention. One hundred native French speakers, with an average age of 47.5, participated in the study and had no prior knowledge of the newly acquired language. We randomly divided the participants into two groups (2D and VR). They studied 550 words in a new language for five days: 30 min each evening and 15 min in the morning. The post-learning test pointed out that both groups improved their vocabulary scores significantly. Approximately one month after the learning experience, we administered a knowledge retention test to 32 participants and found that the level of knowledge had been retained. Finally, background variables (e.g., gender, age, and previous knowledge of the newly acquired language) did not affect the learning results. The findings indicate that CALL, which integrates background cognitive and emotional stimuli in both learning environments, significantly accelerates learning pace, broadens the scope of newly acquired words, and ensures retention. The level of improvement observed in our study is notably higher than that reported in the literature for studies that had previously evaluated CALL and in-class language acquisition.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=David&amp;aulast=Passig&amp;atitle=Technological+Interface+Components+That+Support+Accelerated+Learning+in+the+Acquisition+of+Foreign+Language+Vocabulary&amp;stitle=Applied+Sciences&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.3390%2Fapp142210436&amp;title=Technological+Interface+Components+That+Support+Accelerated+Learning+in+the+Acquisition+of+Foreign+Language+Vocabulary&amp;volume=14&amp;issue=22&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=10436&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=David&amp;aulast=Passig&amp;atitle=Technological+Interface+Components+That+Support+Accelerated+Learning+in+the+Acquisition+of+Foreign+Language+Vocabulary&amp;stitle=Applied+Sciences&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.3390%2Fapp142210436&amp;title=Technological+Interface+Components+That+Support+Accelerated+Learning+in+the+Acquisition+of+Foreign+Language+Vocabulary&amp;volume=14&amp;issue=22&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=10436&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Mining Vocational Educational Data to Analyse the Effectiveness of a Blended Learning Model in Programming Courses

Author: Zakaria, Aml1; AbdelRaheem, Mohamed1; Soliman, Taysir Hassan A21 Egyptian-German Colleague of Technology, Misr International Technological University,IT Department,Assiut,EGYPT2 Assiut University,Faculty of Computers and Information,Information Science Department,Assiut,EGYPT

Publication info: Zakaria, Aml; AbdelRaheem, Mohamed; Soliman, Taysir Hassan A. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/mining-vocational-educational-data-analyse/docview/3131916390/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 6th Novel Intelligent and Leading Emerging Sciences Conference (NILES) Conference Start Date: 2024, Oct. 19 Conference End Date: 2024, Oct. 21 Conference Location: Giza, Egypt This study investigates the impact of a blended learning strategy on programming education, combining online and face-to-face instruction. A station rotation model was implemented in a JavaScript course for secondary vocational school students, with an intervention group using blended learning and a control group using traditional face-to-face instruction. The course was designed using problem-based learning and Bloom's taxonomy to promote higher-order thinking skills. Educational Data Mining (EDM) was employed to analyze the effectiveness of the blended learning strategy. The results showed the superiority of applying blended learning model over the traditional teaching one in terms of student performance. Also, the adopted model improve the knowledge retention and engagement level of the students

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Aml&amp;aulast=Zakaria&amp;atitle=Mining+Vocational+Educational+Data+to+Analyse+the+Effectiveness+of+a+Blended+Learning+Model+in+Programming+Courses&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FNILES63360.2024.10753253&amp;title=Mining+Vocational+Educational+Data+to+Analyse+the+Effectiveness+of+a+Blended+Learning+Model+in+Programming+Courses&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

A Study on User's Cognitive Needs in Virtual Reality Training Systems from an Embodied Cognition Perspective

Author: Zhou, Yang1; Zhang, Zhisheng1; Wu, Wenyu1; Xia, Zhijie21 Southeast University,School of Mechanical Engineering,Naning,China2 LTD Southeast University,Jiangsu Nangao Innovation Center for Intelligent Equipment,Naning,China

Publication info: Zhou, Yang; Zhang, Zhisheng; Wu, Wenyu; Xia, Zhijie. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/study-on-users-cognitive-needs-virtual-reality/docview/3127719724/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 30th International Conference on Mechatronics and Machine Vision in Practice (M2VIP) Conference Start Date: 2024, Oct. 3 Conference End Date: 2024, Oct. 5 Conference Location: Leeds, United Kingdom Virtual reality (VR) technology has been successfully applied to training and learning across multiple fields, significantly enhancing user training outcomes and experience. However, current research on virtual equipment training platforms primarily focuses on virtual assembly, algorithm optimization, and collision detection, with little emphasis on user experience and immersion. Therefore, this paper explores the cognitive needs of users in VR-based training environments from the perspective of embodied cognition. Through Think-aloud experiments, user research, and the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP), combined with insights from embodied cognition theory, the primary factors affecting user cognition in virtual reality equipment training are identified. These factors can provide guidance for the design of future VR training systems, ensuring they are more aligned with natural learning processes and user interactions, ultimately leading to improved user satisfaction, deeper knowledge retention, and more effective training outcomes.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Yang&amp;aulast=Zhou&amp;atitle=A+Study+on+User%27s+Cognitive+Needs+in+Virtual+Reality+Training+Systems+from+an+Embodied+Cognition+Perspective&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FM2VIP62491.2024.10746113&amp;title=A+Study+on+User%27s+Cognitive+Needs+in+Virtual+Reality+Training+Systems+from+an+Embodied+Cognition+Perspective&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Yang&amp;aulast=Zhou&amp;atitle=A+Study+on+User%27s+Cognitive+Needs+in+Virtual+Reality+Training+Systems+from+an+Embodied+Cognition+Perspective&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FM2VIP62491.2024.10746113&amp;title=A+Study+on+User%27s+Cognitive+Needs+in+Virtual+Reality+Training+Systems+from+an+Embodied+Cognition+Perspective&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

Knowledge Retention in Incremental Learning using Deep Neural Networks

Author: Kumar, Ashutosh1; Agarwal, Sonali11 Indian Institute of Information Technology Allahabad,Department of Information Technology,Prayagraj,Uttar Pradesh,India

Publication info: Kumar, Ashutosh; Agarwal, Sonali. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/knowledge-retention-incremental-learning-using/docview/3124819112/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 15th International Conference on Computing Communication and Networking Technologies (ICCCNT) Conference Start Date: 2024, June 24 Conference End Date: 2024, June 28 Conference Location: Kamand, India We are attempting to address the problem of catastrophic forgetting in continual learning, in which the model forgets previously learned information upon learning new information. So, we are trying to train a model on some tasks and then utilize the updated weights and parameters for the new task while preserving the model’s ability to perform classification of the old and new tasks correctly. Also, as the model must learn a vast amount of new information over time, it is impossible to store all the information as the model will have limited memory. Therefore, the model should also learn what to forget and what not to forget. This research proposed a new approach for continual learning that draws inspiration from the way Hebbian learning occurs in biological systems. The relevance of each neural network parameter is calculated during model training based on the sensitivity of the final output function that changes in the parameter. Modifying parameters during the training of a new task will impose penalties, thereby avoiding the loss of important knowledge from previous tasks. Using the AlexNet model, we are putting our strategy to the test on several object identification tasks.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Ashutosh&amp;aulast=Kumar&amp;atitle=Knowledge+Retention+in+Incremental+Learning+using+Deep+Neural+Networks&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICCCNT61001.2024.10725188&amp;title=Knowledge+Retention+in+Incremental+Learning+using+Deep+Neural+Networks&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Ashutosh&amp;aulast=Kumar&amp;atitle=Knowledge+Retention+in+Incremental+Learning+using+Deep+Neural+Networks&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICCCNT61001.2024.10725188&amp;title=Knowledge+Retention+in+Incremental+Learning+using+Deep+Neural+Networks&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

Efficient Meeting Insights: NLP-Enhanced Summarization of Voice and Text

Author: Brahmachari, K Sankar1; Hanumesh, Mangaluru1; Anitha, G1; Pattanaik, Balachandra21 Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham,Amrita School of Computing,Department of Computer Science and Engineering,Chennai,Tamil Nadu,India2 Wollega University,School of Electrical Computer Engineering,Nekemte, Ethiopia,Africa

Publication info: Brahmachari, K Sankar; Hanumesh, Mangaluru; Anitha, G; Pattanaik, Balachandra. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/efficient-meeting-insights-nlp-enhanced/docview/3124818168/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 15th International Conference on Computing Communication and Networking Technologies (ICCCNT) Conference Start Date: 2024, June 24 Conference End Date: 2024, June 28 Conference Location: Kamand, India In order to improve meeting efficiency in the ever-changing workplace, research has mostly focused on sophisticated text summarization techniques such as machine learning, hybrid, semantic, and graph-based methods. These approaches have shown efficient in extracting key information from lengthy talks, hence dramatically improving decision-making and knowledge retention. However, their potential has been somewhat limited by a major concentration on processing material in a single language, which ignores the complex, multilingual environment of modern global enterprises. Our most recent research project tries to overcome this gap by combining these various summarizing approaches into acomplete, language-neutral framework.Furthermore, to address the specific difficulty of long meetings, when extracting insights might be especially difficult for those who are not there, we propose using the Longformer encoder-decoder paradigm. This methodology excels at distilling lengthy talks into digestible summaries, regardless of the original language, ensuring that critical insights are easily accessible to anybody, hence increasing inclusion and comprehension across multinational teams.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=K&amp;aulast=Brahmachari&amp;atitle=Efficient+Meeting+Insights%3A+NLP-Enhanced+Summarization+of+Voice+and+Text&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FICCCNT61001.2024.10725706&amp;title=Efficient+Meeting+Insights%3A+NLP-Enhanced+Summarization+of+Voice+and+Text&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

A Four-Cohort Study Testing the Relative Impact of Take-Home and In-Class Examination on Students' Academic Performance and Wellbeing

Author: Spiegel, Tali    ; Nivette, Amy    

Publication info: Spiegel, Tali; Nivette, Amy. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/four-cohort-study-testing-relative-impact-take/docview/3123162662/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: The current study examines the relative impact of take home (open book) examinations (THE) and in class (closed book) examinations (ICE) on student academic performance and wellbeing outcomes. Specifically, this study contributes to our understanding about students' long-term knowledge retention, measured four to six months after completing the course. A unique longitudinal dataset consisting of four cohorts of a social science bachelor and master course that implemented either a THE or ICE in successive years was used. Survey data included wellbeing and academic performance measures as well as a 10-item knowledge retention quiz. Within the master course, the ICE cohort had higher examination grades and higher knowledge retention scores than the cohorts that completed a THE. In the bachelor course, there were no differences in knowledge retention across cohorts. Examination score was associated with higher knowledge retention scores across both courses. One bachelor cohort reported lower wellbeing compared to others (cohort 2021-2022); however, we found no further differences in academic or wellbeing outcomes based on examination form. The findings suggest a slight advantage of ICEs over THEs with regard to academic performance.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Tali&amp;aulast=Spiegel&amp;atitle=A+Four-Cohort+Study+Testing+the+Relative+Impact+of+Take-Home+and+In-Class+Examination+on+Students%27+Academic+Performance+and+Wellbeing&amp;stitle=European+Journal+of+Psychology+of+Education&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1007%2Fs10212-024-00821-w&amp;title=A+Four-Cohort+Study+Testing+the+Relative+Impact+of+Take-Home+and+In-Class+Examination+on+Students%27+Academic+Performance+and+Wellbeing&amp;volume=39&amp;issue=4&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=3943&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Tali&amp;aulast=Spiegel&amp;atitle=A+Four-Cohort+Study+Testing+the+Relative+Impact+of+Take-Home+and+In-Class+Examination+on+Students%27+Academic+Performance+and+Wellbeing&amp;stitle=European+Journal+of+Psychology+of+Education&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1007%2Fs10212-024-00821-w&amp;title=A+Four-Cohort+Study+Testing+the+Relative+Impact+of+Take-Home+and+In-Class+Examination+on+Students%27+Academic+Performance+and+Wellbeing&amp;volume=39&amp;issue=4&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=3943&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Evaluating the Dynamics of Learning Approaches: A Systematic Review Investigating the Nexus between Teaching Methods and Academic Performance in Medical and Dental Education

Author: Roehe, Marlen A    ; Trost, Carmen    ; Grundnig, Julia S    ; Anvari-Pirsch, Anahit; Holzinger, Anita

Publication info: Roehe, Marlen A; Trost, Carmen; Grundnig, Julia S; Anvari-Pirsch, Anahit; Holzinger, Anita. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/evaluating-dynamics-learning-approaches/docview/3123162519/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: In recent decades, a noticeable trend has emerged in medical and dental schools to adjust their curricula to promote learning strategies and habits geared towards long-term knowledge retention. This systematic review therefore sought to examine whether different teaching methods influence students' preferred learning approaches (deep, strategic, and surface approach) and indirectly affect their academic performance. Furthermore, it provides a comprehensive overview of the inconsistencies evident in previous literature regarding the relationship between learning approaches and academic performance of medical and dental students. A thorough search across eight databases yielded 49 relevant studies published between the years 2000 and 2023. The majority of studies revealed that whilst deep and strategic learners tend to excel at medical or dental school, surface learners appear to struggle under intense workload and pressure. Hence, a common consensus emerged amongst the existing literature that there is a relative benefit in attempting to guide students towards deep and strategic learning habits and to minimise surface-related learning strategies. However, results also conveyed that merely modifying the teaching methods used in medical and dental schools has limited merit. As such, the results emphasised the lack of a 'one-size-fits-all' teaching method. Common factors influencing learning approaches were subsequently identified, and based on these findings, an outlook was put forth to integrate a cognitive neuroscience approach into higher education. These directions for future investigations aim to help students reach their full potential by understanding the processes underlying efficient learning and by being mindful of respective encouraging and discouraging factors.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Marlen&amp;aulast=Roehe&amp;atitle=Evaluating+the+Dynamics+of+Learning+Approaches%3A+A+Systematic+Review+Investigating+the+Nexus+between+Teaching+Methods+and+Academic+Performance+in+Medical+and+Dental+Education&amp;stitle=Educational+Psychology+Review&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1007%2Fs10648-024-09952-4&amp;title=Evaluating+the+Dynamics+of+Learning+Approaches%3A+A+Systematic+Review+Investigating+the+Nexus+between+Teaching+Methods+and+Academic+Performance+in+Medical+and+Dental+Education&amp;volume=36&amp;issue=4&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Marlen&amp;aulast=Roehe&amp;atitle=Evaluating+the+Dynamics+of+Learning+Approaches%3A+A+Systematic+Review+Investigating+the+Nexus+between+Teaching+Methods+and+Academic+Performance+in+Medical+and+Dental+Education&amp;stitle=Educational+Psychology+Review&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1007%2Fs10648-024-09952-4&amp;title=Evaluating+the+Dynamics+of+Learning+Approaches%3A+A+Systematic+Review+Investigating+the+Nexus+between+Teaching+Methods+and+Academic+Performance+in+Medical+and+Dental+Education&amp;volume=36&amp;issue=4&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

SSPOT-VR: An Immersive and Affordable Mobile Application for Supporting K-12 Students in Learning Programming Concepts

Author: Gustavo Martins Nunes Avellar    ; Fioravanti, Maria Lydia; William Simao   de   Deus; Kalinka Regina Lucas Jaquie Castelo Branco; Barbosa, Ellen Francine

Publication info: Gustavo Martins Nunes Avellar; Fioravanti, Maria Lydia; William Simao de Deus; Kalinka Regina Lucas Jaquie Castelo Branco; Barbosa, Ellen Francine. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/sspot-vr-immersive-affordable-mobile-application/docview/3123159965/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: High-resolution displays on mobile devices, accurate motion sensors, and efficient mobile processors have taken virtual reality (VR), essentially employed in laboratory, to everyday environments, including homes, workplaces, and classrooms. Regarding programming education, it has been investigated in conjunction with various educational strategies, such as block-based programming (BBP), metaphors, and storytelling. However, studies that adopt VR predominantly employ high-end head-mounted displays (HMDs) and powerful computers to deliver interactive and immersive learning experiences. Conversely, investigations involving mobile platforms and low-cost HMDs often lack user interactivity. Towards filling that gap, this study introduces SSPOT-VR (Space Station for Programming Training in Virtual Reality), a cost-effective solution tailored for children and teenagers that integrates interactive methods for the teaching and learning of programming concepts and the simulated experience of an immersive digitally created world. Three surveys, namely S[subscript 1], S[subscript 2] and S[subscript 3], involving SSPOT-VR and K-12 students were conducted. S[subscript 1] and S[subscript 2] focused on user acceptance (n[subscript 1] = 124 and n[subscript 2] = 16 ) and S[subscript 3] centered on knowledge retention (n[subscript 3] = 31 ). The results indicate students are inclined to accept SSPOT-VR as a valuable educational tool, since it effectively facilitates the retention of programming knowledge through its engaging and interactive learning experiences. By choosing more cost-effective equipment, this research supports the existing body of knowledge while also providing a detailed description of how an effective solution is designed, developed, and used. The approach enhances both affordability and potential applications of immersive VR in programming education.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=&amp;aulast=Gustavo+Martins+Nunes+Avellar&amp;atitle=SSPOT-VR%3A+An+Immersive+and+Affordable+Mobile+Application+for+Supporting+K-12+Students+in+Learning+Programming+Concepts&amp;stitle=Education+and+Information+Technologies&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1007%2Fs10639-024-12499-0&amp;title=SSPOT-VR%3A+An+Immersive+and+Affordable+Mobile+Application+for+Supporting+K-12+Students+in+Learning+Programming+Concepts&amp;volume=29&amp;issue=13&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=16411&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=&amp;aulast=Gustavo+Martins+Nunes+Avellar&amp;atitle=SSPOT-VR%3A+An+Immersive+and+Affordable+Mobile+Application+for+Supporting+K-12+Students+in+Learning+Programming+Concepts&amp;stitle=Education+and+Information+Technologies&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1007%2Fs10639-024-12499-0&amp;title=SSPOT-VR%3A+An+Immersive+and+Affordable+Mobile+Application+for+Supporting+K-12+Students+in+Learning+Programming+Concepts&amp;volume=29&amp;issue=13&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=16411&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

Title: SSPOT-VR: An Immersive and Affordable Mobile Application for Supporting K-12 Students in Learning Programming Concepts

Combination of Ipsative and Sociomaterial Assessment Methodologies within University-Level Science Education

Author: Kukol, Andreas    

Publication info: Kukol, Andreas. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/scholarly-journals/combination-ipsative-sociomaterial-assessment/docview/3123158568/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: This article presents a comprehensive exploration of ipsative and sociomaterial assessment methodologies, dissecting their theoretical frameworks, practical implementations, and the resultant effects on educational paradigms. The purpose of this article is to introduce a combined ipsative-sociomaterial assessment framework for science education at universities. The potential of this novel assessment methodology to influence student engagement, knowledge retention and educator practices is explored. Through a detailed analysis of existing literature and case studies, the article seeks to understand how these methods can transform science education. Four key themes are emerging: science education naturally leads to sociomaterial assessment, enhancing learning through ipsative feedback, measuring personal learning gain and reconciling ipsative with conventional assessment practices in the era of generative AI. Practical aspects of implementation in different online learning environments are discussed as well as institutional challenges that must be overcome. It is concluded that ipsative-sociomaterial assessment represents a transformative, yet natural approach in science higher education with the promise to enhance the educational experience and to provide a richer, more accurate reflection of student learning and achievement.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Andreas&amp;aulast=Kukol&amp;atitle=Combination+of+Ipsative+and+Sociomaterial+Assessment+Methodologies+within+University-Level+Science+Education&amp;stitle=Higher+Education+for+the+Future&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1177%2F23476311241268970&amp;title=Combination+of+Ipsative+and+Sociomaterial+Assessment+Methodologies+within+University-Level+Science+Education&amp;volume=11&amp;issue=2&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=220&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Andreas&amp;aulast=Kukol&amp;atitle=Combination+of+Ipsative+and+Sociomaterial+Assessment+Methodologies+within+University-Level+Science+Education&amp;stitle=Higher+Education+for+the+Future&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1177%2F23476311241268970&amp;title=Combination+of+Ipsative+and+Sociomaterial+Assessment+Methodologies+within+University-Level+Science+Education&amp;volume=11&amp;issue=2&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=220&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=article&amp;

WedaGPT — Generative-AI (with Custom-Trained Meta’s Llama2 LLM), Blockchain, Self Sovereign Identity, NFT and Model Card Enabled Indigenous Medicine Platform

Author: Bandara, Eranga1; Foytik, Peter1; Shetty, Sachin1; Mukkamala, Ravi1; Rahman, Abdul2; Liang, Xueping3; Ng, Wee Keong4; Kasun De Zoysa51 Old Dominion University,Norfolk,VA,USA2 Deloitte & Touche LLP3 Florida International University,USA4 Nanyang Technological University,Singapore5 University of Colombo,Sri Lanka

Publication info: Bandara, Eranga; Foytik, Peter; Shetty, Sachin; Mukkamala, Ravi; Rahman, Abdul; et al. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/wedagpt-generative-ai-with-custom-trained-meta-s/docview/3123120080/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 IEEE Symposium on Computers and Communications (ISCC) Conference Start Date: 2024, June 26 Conference End Date: 2024, June 29 Conference Location: Paris, France Traditional and indigenous medicine, deeply rooted in ancient traditions and wisdom, plays a crucial role in global healthcare and cultural identity. These practices provide treatments for illnesses such as cancer and bone injuries, which often lack effective remedies in Western medicine. However, these valuable systems face challenges like potential knowledge loss, undervaluation of practitioners’ expertise, and the risk of fraud due to the absence of credential verification mechanisms. In this research, we introduce "WedaGPT," a Generative AI-enabled platform that utilizes a custom-trained Meta’s Llama2 Large Language Model (LLM), Blockchain, self-sovereign identity (SSI), Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), and model cards to share traditional medical knowledge and address these issues. WedaGPT creates a collaborative ecosystem connecting doctors, medicine providers, therapists, patients, and technology experts, all committed to preserving and advancing traditional healing practices. This platform enables secure and transparent contributions from all stakeholders to patient well-being. Ancient medical recipe books are translated into English and digitized into PDF formats to enrich the platform’s knowledge base. These texts are used to fine-tune the Llama2 LLM, which has been quantized and optimized with Qlora for performance on consumer-grade hardware. Through a chat-based interface in the SSI-enabled mobile wallet, users can interact with the LLM and access detailed information on treatments, recipes, prescriptions, and healing methods. Additionally, users can consult remotely with doctors who prescribe treatments through this wallet. A key feature of WedaGPT is transforming ancient medicinal recipes into NFT tokens for sale on NFT marketplaces, giving traditional knowledge digital authenticity and economic value. Revenue from these sales is distributed among platform contributors, promoting equitable ownership and recognition. Medical recipe data, including treatment histories and physician details, are encapsulated in Model Cards and securely stored on the blockchain. This system offers mechanisms to verify doctors and treatments in a privacy-preserving way, potentially reducing fraud and medication errors.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Eranga&amp;aulast=Bandara&amp;atitle=WedaGPT+%26mdash%3B+Generative-AI+%28with+Custom-Trained+Meta%26rsquo%3Bs+Llama2+LLM%29%2C+Blockchain%2C+Self+Sovereign+Identity%2C+NFT+and+Model+Card+Enabled+Indigenous+Medicine+Platform&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FISCC61673.2024.10733674&amp;title=WedaGPT+%E2%80%94+Generative-AI+%28with+Custom-Trained+Meta%E2%80%99s+Llama2+LLM%29%2C+Blockchain%2C+Self+Sovereign+Identity%2C+NFT+and+Model+Card+Enabled+Indigenous+Medicine+Platform&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Eranga&amp;aulast=Bandara&amp;atitle=WedaGPT+%26mdash%3B+Generative-AI+%28with+Custom-Trained+Meta%26rsquo%3Bs+Llama2+LLM%29%2C+Blockchain%2C+Self+Sovereign+Identity%2C+NFT+and+Model+Card+Enabled+Indigenous+Medicine+Platform&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FISCC61673.2024.10733674&amp;title=WedaGPT+%E2%80%94+Generative-AI+%28with+Custom-Trained+Meta%E2%80%99s+Llama2+LLM%29%2C+Blockchain%2C+Self+Sovereign+Identity%2C+NFT+and+Model+Card+Enabled+Indigenous+Medicine+Platform&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;

The Gamification Advantage: Innovating Education through Engagement

Author: Strousopoulos, Panagiotis1; Troussas, Christos1; Krouska, Akrivi1; Sgouropoulou, Cleo11 University of West Attica,Department of Informatics and Computer Engineering,Egaleo,Greece

Publication info: Strousopoulos, Panagiotis; Troussas, Christos; Krouska, Akrivi; Sgouropoulou, Cleo. 

http://ezproxy.lb.polyu.edu.hk/login?url=https://www.proquest.com/conference-papers-proceedings/gamification-advantage-innovating-education/docview/3122284606/se-2?accountid=16210

Abstract: Conference Title: 2024 9th South-East Europe Design Automation, Computer Engineering, Computer Networks and Social Media Conference (SEEDA-CECNSM) Conference Start Date: 2024, Sept. 20 Conference End Date: 2024, Sept. 22 Conference Location: Athens, Greece The study identifies how the game elements of points, badges, and leaderboards could be used to engage students to enhance learning outcomes in educational settings. As the innovative teaching paradigm is gaining importance every day, gamification is unrolling as a provoking approach to engaging and motivating students by making the learning process more captivating and interactive. Thus, the main goal is to consider how these factors impact students' intrinsic and extrinsic motivation and how they can result in better academic performance and higher knowledge retention. Besides, the work will help to evaluate how consistent gamification is with the existing educational theories, which are behaviorism, constructivism, and cognitivism, and how these theories help to implement those elements of gamification effectively. The paper discusses how its practicality and success in diverse educational environments have been highlighted using a good number of case studies. Eventually, it tries to give an overall view of gamification's role in modern education and emphasizes the potentiality of redefining traditional learning paradigms.

Links: https://julac-hkpu.primo.exlibrisgroup.com/openurl/852JULAC_HKPU/852JULAC_HKPU:HKPU?sid=proquest&amp;auinit=Panagiotis&amp;aulast=Strousopoulos&amp;atitle=The+Gamification+Advantage%3A+Innovating+Education+through+Engagement&amp;stitle=The+Institute+of+Electrical+and+Electronics+Engineers%2C+Inc.+%28IEEE%29+Conference+Proceedings&amp;btitle=&amp;id=doi:10.1109%2FSEEDA-CECNSM63478.2024.00045&amp;title=The+Gamification+Advantage%3A+Innovating+Education+through+Engagement&amp;volume=&amp;issue=&amp;date=2024&amp;spage=&amp;isbn=&amp;genre=proceeding&amp;
